p.span: Apache ActiveMQ is a popular and powerful open source messaging server. Apache ActiveMQ is fast, supports many cross language clients and protocols, comes with easy to use enterprise integration patterns and many advanced features while fully supporting JMS 1.1, J2EE 1.4, AMQP 1.0.

li.p: This report is being filed based on a request from some board members during the April 2016 meeting. The request is to recap the results of challenges within the ActiveMQ project during the 2014-2015 time frame

li.span: The April 2015 ActiveMQ Board Report included the following activities:
Bruce Snyder elected to the PMC chair position
The June 2015 ActiveMQ Board Report included the following activities:

span.span: Donated code base renamed to ActiveMQ Artemis (based on a vote)

li.span: The HornetQ code donation was officially renamed to ActiveMQ Artemis
Marc Schöchlin voted in as a committer
Jeff Genender voted in as a committer

ul.li: Unfortunately this activity was not noted in the August 2015 ActiveMQ Board Report
I, Bruce Snyder, was still new to the position of PMC chair and failed to add this item to the board report

The August 2015 ActiveMQ Board Report included the following activities:
Christopher Shannon was added to the PMC

The February 2016 ActiveMQ Board Report included the following activities:
Christopher Shannon was added to the PMC on Sun Jan 24 2016
Jeff Genender was added to the PMC on Sun Jan 24 2016

Regarding the overarching question that was asked about the turmoil within the ActiveMQ project in 2014-2015 timeframe:
Neither were there any disagreements in the second half of 2015 nor have there been any disagreements in 2016
